001package imagingbook.calibration.zhang;
002
003import org.apache.commons.math3.analysis.MultivariateMatrixFunction;
004import org.apache.commons.math3.analysis.MultivariateVectorFunction;
005
006import java.awt.geom.Point2D;
007import java.util.Arrays;
008
009/**
010 * Nonlinear optimizer based on the Levenberg-Marquart method, where the Jacobian matrix is calculated numerically
011 * (i.e., by estimating the first partial derivatives from finite differences). The advantage is that the calculation of
012 * the Jacobian is independent of the calibration model, while performance and runtime are similar to the analytic
013 * version (see {@link NonlinearOptimizerAnalytic}).
014 *
015 * @author WB
016 */
017public class NonlinearOptimizerNumeric extends NonlinearOptimizer {
018        
019        NonlinearOptimizerNumeric(Point2D[] modelPts, Point2D[][] obsPts) {
020                super(modelPts, obsPts);
021        }
022        
023        @Override
024        MultivariateVectorFunction makeValueFun() {
025                return new ValueFun();
026        }
027
028        @Override
029        MultivariateMatrixFunction makeJacobianFun() {
030                return new JacobianFun();
031        }
032
033        private class JacobianFun implements MultivariateMatrixFunction {
034
035                /**
036                 * Calculates a "stacked" Jacobian matrix with 2MN rows and K = 7 + 6M columns (for M views with N points each,
037                 * K parameters). For example, with M = 5 views and N = 256 points each, J is of size 2560 Ã— 37. Each pair of
038                 * rows in the Jacobian corresponds to one point. THIS VERSION only calculates single blocks of the Jacobian!
039                 */
040                @Override
041            public double[][] value(double[] params) {
042                        final int K = params.length;
043                double[][] J = new double[2 * M * N][K];        // the Jacobian matrix (initialized to zeroes!)
044                double[] refValues = new double[2 * M * N];     // values obtained with undisturbed parameters 
045                
046                double[] a = Arrays.copyOfRange(params, 0, camParLength);       // camera parameters
047                Camera camOrig = new Camera(a);
048                
049                // Step 0: calculate all 2MN reference output values (for undisturbed parameters)
050               
051                for (int r = 0, i = 0; i < M; i++) {    // for all views, r = row
052                        int m = camParLength + viewParLength * i;
053                                double[] w = Arrays.copyOfRange(params, m, m + viewParLength);
054                                ViewTransform view = new ViewTransform(w);
055                        for (int j = 0; j < N; j++) {   // for all model points: calculate reference values
056                                double[] uv = camOrig.project(view, modelPts[j]);
057                                refValues[r + 0] = uv[0];
058                                refValues[r + 1] = uv[1];
059                                r = r + 2;
060                        }                
061                }
062                
063                // Step 1: calculate the leftmost (green) block of J associated with camera intrinsics
064                
065                for (int k = 0; k < a.length; k++) {    // for all camera parameters
066                        double ak = a[k];                                       // keep original parameter value        
067                        double delta = estimateDelta(ak);
068                        a[k] = a[k] + delta;            // modify parameter s_k
069                        Camera camMod = new Camera(a);  // modified camera
070                        
071                        for (int r = 0, i = 0; i < M; i++) {    // for all views, r = row
072                                int m = camParLength + i * viewParLength;
073                                double[] w = Arrays.copyOfRange(params, m, m + viewParLength);
074                                ViewTransform view = new ViewTransform(w);
075                                for (int j = 0; j < N; j++) {   // for all model points: calculate disturbed value
076                                        Point2D Pj = modelPts[j];
077                                        double[] uvMod = camMod.project(view, Pj);
078                                        J[r + 0][k] = (uvMod[0] - refValues[r + 0]) / delta;   // dX
079                                        J[r + 1][k] = (uvMod[1] - refValues[r + 1]) / delta;   // dY
080                                        r = r + 2;
081                                }    
082                        }
083                        a[k] = ak;      // return parameter s_k to original
084                }
085                
086                // Step 2: calculate the diagonal blocks, one for each view
087                
088                for (int i = 0; i < M; i++) {   // for all views/blocks
089                        final int start = camParLength + i * viewParLength;
090                        double[] w = Arrays.copyOfRange(params, start, start + viewParLength);
091                        final int c = a.length + i * w.length;          // leftmost matrix column of block i
092                        for (int k = 0; k < w.length; k++) {    // for all parameters in w
093                                double wk = w[k];                                       // keep original parameter w_k
094                                double delta = estimateDelta(wk);
095                                w[k] =  w[k] + delta;                           // modify parameter w_k
096                                ViewTransform view = new ViewTransform(w);
097                                int r = 2 * i * N;      // row
098                                for (int j = 0; j < N; j++) {           // for all model points: calculate disturbed value
099                                        Point2D Pj = modelPts[j];
100                                        double[] uvMod = camOrig.project(view, Pj);
101                                        J[r + 0][c + k] = (uvMod[0] - refValues[r + 0]) / delta;   // dX
102                                        J[r + 1][c + k] = (uvMod[1] - refValues[r + 1]) / delta;   // dY
103                                        r = r + 2;
104                                } 
105                                w[k] = wk; // w[k] - DELTA;             // return parameter w_k to original
106                        }
107                }
108                
109//                      long endtime = System.nanoTime();
110//                      System.out.println("time diff = " + (endtime - starttime) + " ns");
111//              System.out.println(NonlinearOptimizerNumeric.class.getSimpleName() + 
112//                              ": Jacobian inverse condition number = " + MathUtil.inverseConditionNumber(J));
113                return J;
114            }
115                
116                 // THIS VERSION calculates all entries of the Jacobian (NOT USED)!
117            
118            @Deprecated
119            @SuppressWarnings("unused")
120                public double[][] value(double[] params, boolean dummy) {
121                //long starttime = System.nanoTime();
122                //System.out.println("getJacobianMatrix - NUMERICAL");
123                // M = number of views, N = number of model points
124                double[][] J = new double[2 * M * N][params.length];    // the Jacobian matrix
125                double[] refValues = new double[2 * M * N];     // function values obtained with undisturbed parameters 
126                
127                double[] s = Arrays.copyOfRange(params, 0, camParLength);
128                Camera cam = new Camera(s);
129                
130                // Step 0: calculate all 2MN reference output values (for undisturbed parameters)
131                
132                for (int row = 0, m = 0; m < M; m++) {  // for all views
133                        int start = camParLength + m * viewParLength;
134                                double[] w = Arrays.copyOfRange(params, start, start + viewParLength);
135                                ViewTransform view = new ViewTransform(w);
136                        for (int j = 0; j < N; j++) {   // for all model points: calculate reference values
137                                double[] uv = cam.project(view, modelPts[j]);
138                                refValues[row + 0] = uv[0];
139                                refValues[row + 1] = uv[1];
140                                row = row + 2;
141                        }                
142                }
143                
144                // Step 1: calculate all entries of the Jacobian (brute force!)
145                
146                for (int k = 0; k < params.length; k++) {       // for ALL parameters
147                        int col = k;
148                        // calculate step width and modify the parameter vector c:
149                        double pk = params[k];
150                        double delta = estimateDelta(pk);
151                        params[k] = params[k] + delta;          // modify parameter c_k
152                        
153                        double[] smod = Arrays.copyOfRange(params, 0, camParLength);
154                        Camera camMod = new Camera(smod);       // modified camera
155                        
156                        for (int row = 0, m = 0; m < M; m++) {  // for all views
157                                int start = camParLength + m * viewParLength;
158                                double[] w = Arrays.copyOfRange(params, start, start + viewParLength);
159                                ViewTransform view = new ViewTransform(w);
160                                for (int n = 0; n < N; n++) {   // for all model points: calculate disturbed value
161                                        Point2D Pj = modelPts[n];
162                                        double[] uvMod = camMod.project(view, Pj);
163                                        J[row + 0][col] = (uvMod[0] - refValues[row + 0]) / delta;   // du
164                                        J[row + 1][col] = (uvMod[1] - refValues[row + 1]) / delta;   // dv      
165                                        row = row + 2;
166                                }    
167                        }
168                        params[k] = pk;
169                }
170               
171                long endtime = System.nanoTime();
172//                      System.out.println("time diff = " + (endtime - starttime) + " ns");
173//                      System.out.println(this.getClass().getSimpleName() + 
174//                              ": Jacobian inverse condition number = " + MathUtil.inverseConditionNumber(J));
175                return J;
176            }
177
178        }
179
180        /**
181         * Returns a positive delta value adapted to the magnitude of the parameter x
182         *
183         * @param x
184         * @return
185         */
186    private double estimateDelta(double x) {
187        final double eps = 1.5e-8;      // = sqrt(2.2 * 10^{-16})
188        double dx = eps * Math.max(Math.abs(x), 1); // dx >= eps
189        // avoid numerical truncation problems (add and subtract again) - 
190        // not sure if this survives the compiler !?
191        double tmp = x + dx;
192        return tmp - x;
193    }
194        
195}
196
